attributes.action: instead of paying pension credit to people aged 60-70 who have not saved for retirement, insist that they get a job to top up what pension they do receive.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: It is not fair that those who have paid into pension schemes or saved for retirement should get a smaller state pension than those who have done nothing and receive pension credit. There is no reason why they cannot seek work to top up to the pension credit level, this would save money with which to give a better pension to all on retirement and bring the UK more in line with our EU counterparts.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
